oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery On The Record with Reba McEntire - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Reba McEntire (performer) for Ralph Emery: On the Record With Reba McEntire. Recording is performed in front of a live audience. Recording is from April 20, 1994. Tape is labeled part 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Reba McEntire
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Reba McEntire jokes about a quick change that went wrong during a performance -- (02:08) McEntire recalls a time where she accidentally turned on her portable microphone -- (03:14) Ralph Emery inquires McEntire if she ever had a time where she wished to do something solo -- (03:53) Emery asks McEntire to reflect on the events, of the plane crash in San Diego, that took her band mates lives -- (10:28) Emery and McEntire praise Narvel Blackstock for his toughness during the tragedy -- (11:29) Emery asks McEntire why she decided to release her autobiography -- (12:13) Emery brings up the criticism McEntire received post plane crash -- (13:26) Emery inquires as to what led McEntire to perform at the Academy Awards -- (15:06) Emery inquires about the People Magazine article written about McEntire -- (15:39) Emery praises McEntire for her acting career; additionally, both converse about a time Kenny Rogers called McEntire to perform on The Gambler Returns: Luck of the Draw -- (17:00) Emery plays a clip from The Gambler Returns: The Luck of the Draw; additionally, McEntire reveals the scene played was recorded hours after her time at Fan Fair -- (19:05) Emery plays a clip from North; additionally, McEntire reflects on the story behind North -- (21:46) Emery inquires about the red dress McEntire wore at the 1993 Country Music Association Awards -- (24:50) Emery addresses the story of a time that McEntire had some difficulties at the Grand Ole Opry -- (28:24) Emery asks how much tape the show has left -- (28:36) McEntire and Emery discuss a flub they had with signing -- (29:44) Emery invites McEntire to reflect on how her career effects Shelby McEntire Blackstock, and McEntire tells a story about how Shelby's dogs had difficulties staying alive -- (32:15) Emery insists McEntire recites the 'good boy' story about Shelby -- (33:20) Emery praises McEntire's donation to society and asks her to discuss the Reba Ranch House -- (35:45) Emery expresses his thanks and both say goodbye
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; McEntire, Reba; McEntire, Reba, 1955-;
